intro: Scirpidiella crassiuscula, commonly known as the broad-leaved scirpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist to aquatic environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often clustered at the base, forming dense tussocks. Its inflorescence consists of a spike of small, three-ranked spikelets, which are characteristic of the Cyperaceae family. Scirpidiella crassiuscula plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
